io.flic.lib

Class FlicButton

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.flic.lib.FlicButton

  • public final class FlicButton
extends java.lang.Object
    FlicButton. This class represents a Flic button. Instances of this class cannot be created directly but are returned from the manager. See FlicManager.initiateGrabButton(Activity), FlicManager.getButtonByDeviceId(String) and FlicManager.getKnownButtons().

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int BUTTON_CONNECTION_COMPLETED
      The button is currently connected and button events will arrive immediately when pressed.
      static int BUTTON_CONNECTION_STARTED
      The button is currently not connected but there is a pending connection to it.
      static int BUTTON_DISCONNECTED
      The button is disconnected and there is no pending connection to it.

        public static final int BUTTON_DISCONNECTED
        The button is disconnected and there is no pending connection to it.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • BUTTON_CONNECTION_STARTED

        public static final int BUTTON_CONNECTION_STARTED
        The button is currently not connected but there is a pending connection to it. When it is in range and is pressed, it will connect.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • BUTTON_CONNECTION_COMPLETED

        public static final int BUTTON_CONNECTION_COMPLETED
        The button is currently connected and button events will arrive immediately when pressed.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • addFlicButtonCallback

        public void addFlicButtonCallback(FlicButtonCallback callback)
        Add callbacks for this button. The callbacks remain valid during the lifetime of the application process or until you call FlicManager.forgetButton(FlicButton) for this button. Callbacks are not called during the manager is not in the initialized state. In order to receive callbacks, setFlicButtonCallbackFlags(int) must be called first.
        Parameters:
        callback - The callback object

      • removeFlicButtonCallback

        public void removeFlicButtonCallback(FlicButtonCallback callback)
        Removes a callback for this button.
        Parameters:
        callback - The callback object

      • removeAllFlicButtonCallbacks

        public void removeAllFlicButtonCallbacks()
        Remove all callbacks for this button.

      • setFlicButtonCallbackFlags

        public boolean setFlicButtonCallbackFlags(int flicButtonCallbackFlags)
        Set which button events to listen for. In order to get callbacks added by addFlicButtonCallback(FlicButtonCallback), this method must be called first. If you are concerned about low latencies and performance, only register the flags you actually use. The settings are active as long as the process is running and must be set again when the app process restarts.
        Parameters:
        flicButtonCallbackFlags - A bitwise-or'ed value of FlicButtonCallbackFlags
        Returns:
        true on success, false if manager was in uninitialized state

      • registerListenForBroadcast

        public boolean registerListenForBroadcast(int flicBroadcastReceiverFlags)
        To receive button clicks that also works in the case the app is not currently running, you can set up a broadcast receiver extending FlicBroadcastReceiver. Declare it in your manifest and set android:exported to true and add an intent-filter with the name io.flic.FLICLIB_EVENT. To unregister all events, use FlicBroadcastReceiverFlags.NONE. The settings will remain even if the app process restarts.
        Parameters:
        flicBroadcastReceiverFlags - A bitwise-or'ed value of FlicBroadcastReceiverFlags
        Returns:
        true on success, false if manager was in uninitialized state

      • grabExclusivity

        public boolean grabExclusivity()
        Grab a button exclusivity. This means that this app's callbacks registered by addFlicButtonCallback are the only ones receiving button events on this Android device. No actions will be triggered in neither the Flic app nor any other app. Please release this exclusivity with releaseExclusivity() when you're done. A possible use-case for this is if your app is a wake-up alarm, and you want to use the Flic button to turn off the alarm. Then light up the screen, bring your activity to the foreground and grab button exclusivity. Then when the user presses the button, it will only turn off the alarm and not trigger other functionality the user might have assigned the button. Another use-case is games where button presses should only control the game and do nothing else.
        Returns:
        true on success, false if manager was in uninitialized state

      • releaseExclusivity

        public boolean releaseExclusivity()
        Release a button exclusivity. Call this after grabExclusivity() when you're done with the button.
        Returns:
        true on success, false if manager was in uninitialized state

      • getCallbackFlags

        public int getCallbackFlags()
        Get the current callback flags.
        Returns:
        Callback flags

      • getButtonId

        public java.lang.String getButtonId()
        Get the Bluetooth device address of this button. Can be used to uniquely identify a button.
        Returns:
        The address

      • getConnectionStatus

        public int getConnectionStatus()
        Get the connection status.
        Returns:
        One of BUTTON_DISCONNECTED, BUTTON_CONNECTION_STARTED and BUTTON_CONNECTION_COMPLETED

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Get the name of this button, as assigned in the Flic app. Available in Flic app version >= 2.0
        Returns:
        The name. If Flic app version is < 2.0 or the user has not entered a name, null is returned.

      • getColor

        public java.lang.String getColor()
        Get the color of this button.
        Returns:
        The color as a string. Currently one of "black", "white", "turquoise", "yellow", "green" or "unknown".

      • readRemoteRSSI

        public boolean readRemoteRSSI()
        Read the current RSSI value of the button. FlicButtonCallback.onReadRemoteRSSI(FlicButton, int, int) will be called when a result is available.
        Returns:
        True if the read was successfully initiated

      • setActiveMode

        public boolean setActiveMode(boolean activeMode)
        Set the button to active mode. This decreases the delay, but will consume more battery power. Good for games where it is important with low delays. Please unset active mode as soon as you don't need it anymore.
        Parameters:
        activeMode - True if to use active mode. False to use passive mode.
        Returns:
        True if successful. False if the manager was in uninitialized state.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
